quiz.text: A salesman gives 10% discount on the marked price of the Tupperware items but adds 5% tax on the discounted price. Quantity A: If the selling price of the Tupperware jar is Rs. 850.5 then what is the marked price of the Tupperware jar? Quantity B: 500
options: Quantity A < Quantity B
Quantity A > Quantity B
Quantity A ≤ Quantity B
Quantity A ≥ Quantity B
Quantity A = Quantity B or no relation

quiz.text: On the occasion of Diwali, Anil Ambani distributed some amount of money of Rs 10,000 among the A, B and C. Quantity A: Ratio of distributed money among A, B and C is 7 : 7 : 6. What is the amount earned by C? Quantity B: If C earns Rs 500 less than A and B who earn an equal amount then find the 80% of the average amount received by the A and B.
options: Quantity A < Quantity B
Quantity A > Quantity B
Quantity A ≤ Quantity B
Quantity A ≥ Quantity B
Quantity A = Quantity B or no relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: A Santa Claus satchel contains 7 red, 4 green, 4 yellow, and 5 pink balls. If 4 balls are drawn at random, find the probability that 2 balls are red and 2 balls are green. Quantity II: From a pack of 52 cards, 2 cards of ace are drawn when 5 cards are drawn at random from the deck of cards. Find the Required probability.
options: Quantity A < Quantity B
Quantity A > Quantity B
Quantity A ≤ Quantity B
Quantity A ≥ Quantity B
Quantity A = Quantity B or no relation

quiz.text: Sandhya bought an Alexa echo dot and a Samsung smartwatch from a Croma store such that the storekeeper sold both the items together to Sandhya for Rs.14760. The actual cost price of Alexa echo dot was 64% more than the actual cost price of Samsung smartwatch. What is the cost price of Alexa echo dot? Statement I: After giving a discount of 12% on marked price of Alexa echo dot, storekeeper sold the Alexa echo dot at Rs.2020 more than the marked price of Samsung smartwatch. Statement II: Storekeeper marked Alexa echo dot at 40% above its cost price and allowed a discount of Rs.1260 on its marked price. Statement III: Sandhya bought Samsung smartwatch at Rs.3280 less than Alexa echo dot and storekeeper received a profit of 14.8% on Samsung smartwatch.
options: Only I and II are sufficient
Only III is sufficient
Either II alone or I and II together are sufficient
All I, II and III are necessary to the answer the question
The question can’t be answered even with all I, II and III

quiz.text: Anita is an athlete and is a mother of three children and their names are Chutki, Monu and Nonu. The LCM of ages of Chutki and Monu is 45 and HCF of ages of Monu and Nonu is 5. What is the HCF of the ages of Chutki, Nonu and Monu? (Note: Ages of Chutki, Monu and Nonu are in years) Statement I: Average of ages of Chutki, Nonu and Monu is 11(1/3). Statement II: LCM of ages of Chutki, Nonu and Monu is 90. Statement III: Product of ages of Chutki and Nonu is 90 and age of Chutki after 3 years will be 12.
options: Only I and II are sufficient
Only II and III are sufficient
Either II and III or I and III together are sufficient
All I, II and III are necessary to the answer the question
The question can’t be answered even with all I, II and III

quiz.text: On the occasion of Holi, Chintu contains 21 water balloons of four different colours in a bucket. The bucket contains 4 yellow water balloons, some red, some blue and some orange water balloons. Find the probability of drawing two balloons from the basket such that both the water balloons are of the same colour. Statement I: Probability of drawing one red and one orange water balloon from the bucket is 8/35. Statement II: Probability of drawing one blue water balloon from the bucket is 1/7. Statement III: Probability of drawing one red water balloon from the bucket is 2/7.
options: Only I and II are sufficient
Only II and III are sufficient
Either II alone or I and II together are sufficient
All I, II and III are necessary to the answer the question
Any two are sufficient

quiz.text: Three friends i.e Mr. Aggarwal, Mr. Kapoor and Mr. Arora are partners in a partnership firm. After Mr. Kapoor retired, his daughters Alisha and Dolly are admitted as partners in the firm. In what ratio the profit will be shared between Mr. Aggarwal, Mr. Kapoor, Alisha and Dolly? I. Alisha’s and Dolly's share in the profit is in the ratio 3 ∶ 5 II. Ratio of Mr. Aggarwal, Mr. Kapoor and Mr. Arora was 1 ∶ 2 ∶ 3 III. Mr. Aggarwal’s share is double than Dolly’s share and Mr. Kapoor receives Rs. 10500 out of total profit of Rs. 37500
options: Only I and III are sufficient
Only II and III are sufficient
Either II alone or I and II together are sufficient
All I, II and III are necessary to the answer the question
The question can’t be answered even with all I, II and III
